results.title: Heartlands : minerals
results.brief_description: This programme, presented by Dean Graetz, looks at mining in Australia and the impact and social costs the depletion of ore resources has on mining communities. Changes to mining methods are also covered, with the industry not needing to hire as many people due to the technological advancements in the field. Dean Graetz also highlights the differences in attitudes towards agricultural and pastoral land and mining, stressing that agriculture will sustain us in the future, and not mining, which is a finite resource.

results.title: Heartlands : good work
results.brief_description: Richard Bawden introduces a man with a remarkable solution to Australia’s unemployment figure. Originally a migrant from Italy but now an Australian citizen, he has a vision for a new Australian society based on people as its natural resource. He believes that Australia’s reliance on developing its natural resources has been to the detriment of her people. He has instituted a job creation scheme at Murdoch University in Western Australia based on his vision.

results.title: Heartlands : a matter of fate
results.brief_description: These programs from the ‘Heartlands’ series explore the theory that each individual views the future differently, based on their current life situation, and that as their situation changes, so to does their future outlook. Also explored are some options and outcomes as they may appear if we are prepared to take the challenge of creatively addressing the problems of today. Four people who have a vested interest in the way out future will be are interviewed. Two consultants whose job it is to identify the spectrum of options that might be available, and the implications of some of these outcomes, and two teenagers who will have to live with the consequences of whatever decisions are made today. The program is not about predicting the future - rather the process of creating it

results.title: Heartbreak ridge
results.brief_description: Gunnery Sergeant Tom Highway (Clint Eastwood), war veteran and Medal of Honor recipient from details in Korea and Vietnam has one last tour of duty prior to his forced retirement from the U.S Marines - training a bunch of new recruits. The brashness of a youth who have experienced war passively through film and literature is incongruous with Tom’s traditional hard nosed ways, yet Tom has proven himself to be a complex character also, as the film follows his attempt to rekindle a past relationship with lines that he too has learnt from books. Tom’s skills for preparing men for battle are put to the test when the recruits experience war for the first time during an invasion of Granada. Cast also includes Marsha Mason, Everett McGill, Moses Gunn, Mario Van Peebles and Eileen Heckart.

results.title: Heartbeat of France
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Finch. Music composed by Marguerite Monnet. Sung by Colette Renard. This film, co-produced with Great Britain and France, attempts to depict the personality of “Modern” France. Covers highlights of pre-1960’s history - the revolt in Algeria; the German occupation and France’s part in the two World Wars; the “Indo-China War”; and the influence of General de Gaulle on French history. Illustrates this theory with examples, showing how the average Frenchman lives - a peasant farmer, a Parisian craftsman jeweller, and a worker in the Renault factory.

results.title: Heart, head and hand: Peter Rushforth, potter
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir and Crafts Council of Australia
results.brief_description: Scenes from the life and work of potter Peter Rushforth. This film shows how Rushforth’s philosophy and strong belief in craft as a way of life has reached all those with whom he has been in contact, and the respect and admiration in which he is held both personally and professionally by students, colleagues and friends. Photography by John Seale and music by the Renaissance Players.

results.title: Heart sweet heart
results.creator_credit: B Stepantsev, World Health Organisation and Soiuzmultfilm
results.brief_description: Good heartkeeping makes life better, is the message of this animated cartoon film. Mr Anybody lives in a four-roomed apartment, in the four chambers of his own heart. He loves eating and smoking and hates to move around, but smoke fills his arteries and fat invades his heart. His home starts crumbling, the walls are cracking, the heart is sick. Help arrives in the form of a lady doctor who cleans up the house, throwing out the cigarettes and bringing in fresh air.

results.title: Heart on a chain: the truth about date violence
results.creator_credit: Neal Shusterman, Tom Bull, Sandy Chanley and Coronet
results.brief_description: Abuse in relationships transcends all cultures and is influenced by the media and notions of gender. “Heart on a chain” explores the two significant ways in which relationships may be abuse, recreating a physically abusive relationship and an emotionally violent one. The film is particularly instructive in its definition of what constitutes “abuse”. Aimed primarily at young males this documentary offers an insight into why and how relationships become abusive.

results.title: Heart of darkness
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Joseph Conrad’s classic tale features Tim Roth as Marlow, the British Captain travelling deep into the heart of Africa’s Congo River, and John Malkovich as the elusive Kurtz, a god to native tribes. It is a search that will take them deep into the evil darkness that lurks within the heart of man. Cast includes Tim Roth, John Malkovich, Isaach Bankole, James Fox and Morten Faldaas.
